meanings.definition: A soft white or gray mineral consisting of hydrated calcium sulfate.
meanings.sent1: The miners found a chunk of gypsum in the cave.
meanings.sent2: The walls of the museum were made of gypsum.
meanings.sent3: The playful cat mistook the gypsum for snow and tried to pounce on it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as pure and smooth as gypsum.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used gypsum to explain the concept of minerals to the students.

meanings.definition: A white powder used in making plaster of Paris and cement.
meanings.sent1: The builders mixed gypsum with water to create a strong plaster.
meanings.sent2: The artist used gypsum to make a sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled gypsum into the cake batter, creating a unique texture.
meanings.sent4: The idea was as solid as a block of gypsum.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight reflected off the gypsum, creating a dazzling effect in the room.
